titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual”

shortcontents.shortcontent: Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” (fols. 4ra-154ra) - Introduction (fols. 4ra-10va) - Discourse of St. Athanasius on death (fols. 10va-17va) - Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (fols. 17va-25ra) - Homily by St. Jacob of Serug for the funeral of priests and deacons (fols. 77va-92va) - Homily by ʾabba Sälama, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 96vb-99ra) - Lǝfafä ṣǝdq “Bandlet of Righteousness” (fols. 103va-106rb) - Mängädä sämay “Journey to Heaven” (fols. 106rb-108rb).

owners.owner: Many names are written in the supplication formulas, Fasilädäs (fols. 31va, 39rb, 48ra), Wälättä Śǝllase (fols. 31va, 48ra, 52va), Gäbrä Śǝllase (fols. 32ra, 38vb, 41vb, 45vb), Wälättä ʾArägawi (fols. 32ra, 45vb, 47ra). In the concluding supplication (fol. 154ra) additional names are written in a secondary hand.

dcomments.dcomment: King Ḫaylä Śәllase I (r. 1930-74) is mentioned on fols. 48va, 144va.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn and shows signs of extensive use. Many fols. are stained with wax and dirt; holes are burned into some fols.: 12, 74, 122 with text loss. The sewing is partly broken (s. between fols. 11 and 12; 49 and 50). Holes repaired on fols. 73, 152, 153.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; leather inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, wave form, criss-cross, x-form).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 1/fols. 1r-3v) – I(8/fols. 4r-11v) – II(10; s.l.: 6, stub after 3; 7, stub after 3/fols. 12r-21v) – III(8/fols. 22r-29v) – [n.l.]IV(8/fols. 30r-37v) – V(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 38r-45v) – VI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 46r-53v) – ፯VII(7; s.l.: 4, stub after 4/fols. 54r-60v) – ፰VIII(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5 stub after 4/fols. 61r-68v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – ፲X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – ፲፪XII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 93r-100v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 109r-116v) – ፲፭XV(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5, stub after 4/fols. 117r-124v) – ፲፮XVI(8/fols. 125r-132v) – ፲፯XVII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 133r-140v) – ፲፰XVIII(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 4; 5, stub after 3 /fols. 141r-148v) – XIX(6/fols. 149r-154v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the owners; a few lines on the incipit page, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section of the text; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 (e.g., fols. 33vb, 34ra, 35va, 36ra, 37vb); some other words, e.g., hale luya (e.g., fols. 10vb, 11ra, 13rb), ṣällot (e.g., fols. 25ra, 28va, 35rb, 39ra), wä-kaʿǝbä (e.g., fols. 16vb, 17ra, 17va), wängel (e.g., fols. 34rb, 36rb, 38ra); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., fols. 28vb, 29ra, 31ra). ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ (e.g., fols. 18vab, 20ra, 21rab, 23ra). ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (fols. 28vb, 29ra, 31ra, 32vb). ሃ/ሃ፡ሃ፡ሃ፡/ሃሌ፡ for ሃሌ ሉያ (e.g., fols. 11ra, 14vb, 15ra). ፍ፡ for ፍትሕተ፡ ወንጹሕት፡ ረሰያ፡ ለዛቲ፡ በድን፡ (e.g., fols. 35rb, 36va, 37rb, 37va).

extras.extra: - The word እገሌ "somebody" is underlined on fols. 109r, 114v, 116r, 125v-128v, and written in < > on fol. 33vb. - A prayer (?) is written in the margin in pen, on fol. 120r. - Corrections written interlineally: fols. 10va, 36vb, 41vb. - Some lines are written in smaller script on fol. 154ra, in the main hand. Most of the owner’s names in the supplication formulas are also written in smaller script, in the main hand.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid:
- Note in upper margin referring to content of the text: fols. 10v, 16v. - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in a secondary hand in the upper margin: ዘሠሉስ: fol. 137v ዘረቡዕ: fol. 139r ዘሐሙስ: fol. 140r ዘዓርብ: fol. 143r ዘቀዳሚት: fol. 146r ዘእሑድ: fol. 147v
- Coloured threads have been inserted on fols. 39, 46 (missing), 57, 74, 89, 92.
